name: HTTP Webhook
description: Sends a webhook templated by the incoming event data

inputs_schema.label: Log responses
inputs_schema.description: Logs the response of http calls for debugging.

name: Custom transformation
description: This is a starter template for custom transformations

name: GeoIP
description: Adds geoip data to the event

name: IP Anonymization
description: This transformation sets the last octet of an IP address to zero (e.g., 12.214.31.144 â†’ 12.214.31.0), protecting user privacy and reducing disclosure risk.

name: Remove Null Properties
description: This transformation removes null properties from the event properties object. If the object nesting exceeds 3 levels, deeper levels will be returned unchanged.

name: URL Parameter Masking

inputs_schema.label: URL Properties to Mask
inputs_schema.description: Map of event properties containing URLs and their parameters to mask. Example: {'$current_url': 'email, password'}

inputs_schema.label: Mask Value
inputs_schema.description: The value to replace sensitive parameters with

description: Masks sensitive information in URL parameters (query strings) of specified properties

name: PII Data Hashing

inputs_schema.label: Properties to Hash
inputs_schema.description: Comma-separated list of property paths to hash (e.g. "$ip,$email,$set.$phone")

inputs_schema.label: Hash Distinct ID
inputs_schema.description: Whether to hash the distinct_id field

inputs_schema.label: Salt
inputs_schema.description: Optional salt to add to the hashed values for additional security

description: This transformation hashes sensitive personal data (PII) like email, phone numbers, etc. using SHA-256 to protect user privacy.

name: Filter Bot Events

inputs_schema.label: User Agent Property
inputs_schema.description: The property that contains the user agent string (e.g. $raw_user_agent, $useragent)

inputs_schema.label: Custom Bot Patterns
inputs_schema.description: Additional bot patterns to detect, separated by commas (e.g. mybot,customcrawler)

description: Filters out events from known bot user agents. This transformation will drop the event if a bot is detected.

name: Downsample

inputs_schema.description: A comma-separated list of PostHog events you want to downsample (e.g.: '$identify,mycustomevent'). If empty, all events will be downsampled.
inputs_schema.label: Triggering events

description: Reduces event volume coming into PostHog

name: Language URL stripper

inputs_schema.label: Pattern
inputs_schema.description: Ininitalized with `const regexp = new RegExp($pattern)`

inputs_schema.label: Match group
inputs_schema.description: Used in: `const value = regexp.match($pathname)[$matchGroup]`

inputs_schema.label: Property
inputs_schema.description: Name of the event property we will store the matched value in

inputs_schema.label: Replacement pattern
inputs_schema.description: Initialized with `new RegExp($pattern)`, leave empty to disable path cleanup.

inputs_schema.label: Replacement key
inputs_schema.description: Where to store the updated path. Keep as `$pathname` to override.

inputs_schema.label: Replacement value
inputs_schema.description: `properties[key] = $pathname.replace(pattern, value)`

description: Replace the language from the URL with a custom value

name: URL parameters to event properties

inputs_schema.label: URL query parameters to convert
inputs_schema.description: Comma separated list of URL query parameters to capture. Leaving this blank will capture nothing.

inputs_schema.label: Prefix
inputs_schema.description: Add a prefix to the property name e.g. set it to 'prefix_' to get followerId -> prefix_followerId

inputs_schema.label: Suffix
inputs_schema.description: Add a suffix to the property name e.g. set it to '_suffix' to get followerId -> followerId_suffix

inputs_schema.label: Ignore the case of URL parameters
inputs_schema.description: Ignores the case of parameters e.g. when set to true than followerId would match FollowerId, followerID, FoLlOwErId and similar

inputs_schema.label: Add to user properties
inputs_schema.description: Additionally adds the property to the user properties

inputs_schema.label: Add to user initial properties
inputs_schema.description: Additionally adds the property to the user initial properties. This will add a prefix of 'initial_' before the already fully composed property e.g. initial_prefix_followerId_suffix

inputs_schema.label: Always JSON stringify the property data
inputs_schema.description: If set, always store the resulting data as a JSON array. (Otherwise, single parameters get stored as-is, and multi-value parameters get stored as a JSON array.)

description: Converts URL query parameters to event properties

name: Filter Out Plugin

inputs_schema.label: Filters to apply
inputs_schema.description: A JSON file containing an array of filters to apply. See the README for more information.

inputs_schema.label: Events to filter out
inputs_schema.description: A comma-separated list of event names to filter out (e.g. $pageview,$autocapture)

inputs_schema.label: Keep event if any of the filtered properties are undefined?

description: Filter out events where property values satisfy the given condition

name: URL Normalizer
description: Normalize the format of urls in your application allowing you to more easily compare them in insights.

name: Property Filter

inputs_schema.label: Properties to filter out
inputs_schema.description: A comma-separated list of properties to filter out (e.g. $ip, $current_url)

description: This plugin will set all configured properties to null inside an ingested event.

name: SemVer Flattener

inputs_schema.label: comma separated properties to explode version number from
inputs_schema.description: my_version_number,app_version

description: This plugin will flatten semver versions in the specified properties.

name: Taxonomy
description: Standardize your event names into a single pattern.

name: Timestamp Parser
description: Parse your event timestamps into useful date properties.

name: User Agent Populator

inputs_schema.label: Can override existing browser related properties of event?
inputs_schema.description: If the ingested event already have $browser $browser_version properties in combination with $useragent the $browser, $browser_version properties will be re-populated with the value of $useragent

inputs_schema.label: Automatically read segment_userAgent property, automatically sent by Segment via analytics.js?
inputs_schema.description: Segment's analytics.js library automatically sends a useragent property that Posthog sees as segment_userAgent. Enabling this causes this plugin to parse that property
Enable debug mode to log when the plugin is unable to extract values from the user agent

description: Enhances events with user agent details. User Agent plugin allows you to populate events with the $browser, $browser_version for PostHog Clients that don't  typically populate these properties
